page.title: 07Ecology - Birds
page.content: {Breeding Birds} The more interesting species occur on the estuary mosses; for example: tree pipits, grasshopper warblers and six species of tits. In Storth and Sandside swifts and house-martins nest. {Estuary Birds} Migration periods in spring and autumn may bring rare vagrants, but the large numbers of commoner birds are also remarkable; flocks of thousands of lapwings and hundreds of curlews frequent the sands. At any season a few stately herons, from the large historic heronry at Milnthorpe, fish in the shallows. Swans and shelduck are seen in winter, with mallards and black-headed gulls on Sandside promenade. Diving ducks - mergansers and goldeneye - appear on the river. Towards sunset six species of gull collect to roost on the estuary.
